name: CAST
description: Converts an expression to the specified data type. Raises an error if conversion fails.

examples.title: String to integer
examples.sql: SELECT CAST('123' AS INT) as num

examples.title: Number to string
examples.sql: SELECT 'ID: ' || CAST(id AS VARCHAR) as label FROM users

examples.title: Using :: operator
examples.sql: SELECT id::VARCHAR as id_string FROM users

examples.title: Date conversion
examples.sql: SELECT CAST('2024-01-15' AS DATE) as date_value

examples.title: Decimal precision
examples.sql: SELECT CAST(price AS DECIMAL(10,2)) as formatted_price FROM products

notes: Use TRY_CAST or SAFE_CAST for NULL on failure
Supported types: INT, BIGINT, DOUBLE, DECIMAL, VARCHAR, DATE, TIMESTAMP, BOOLEAN
